text: Do all julia instances run at the same time share one core if no specific option is given when starting julia?

elements.text: Do all julia instances run at the same time share one core if no specific option is given when starting julia?

text: well, when launching two julia processes doing computation under linux, launching htop shows them both at ~50% cpu usage (out of 400% b/c 4 cores)

elements.text: well, when launching two julia processes doing computation under linux, launching htop shows them both at ~50% cpu usage (out of 400% b/c 4 cores)

text: Just a coincidence, the julia processes are independent.

elements.text: Just a coincidence, the julia processes are independent.

text: But julia defaults to using 1 thread, which you can override from an env variable or nowadays from a command line flag iirc

elements.text: But julia defaults to using 1 thread, which you can override from an env variable or nowadays from a command line flag iirc
